meanings.definition: A form of financial aid for students in certain universities.
meanings.sent1: Many students rely on sizarships to afford their education.
meanings.sent2: The university offers sizarships to help students with their expenses.
meanings.sent3: Receiving a sizarship felt like winning a small lottery.
meanings.sent4: Her sizarship was a lifeline in the sea of expensive tuition.
meanings.sent5: The sizarship opportunity shone brightly in the student's eyes.

meanings.definition: The position or status of being a sizar.
meanings.sent1: His sizarship at the university gave him a sense of belonging.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her sizarship among her peers.
meanings.sent3: Being in a sizarship felt like being part of an exclusive club.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of students, his sizarship was respected.
meanings.sent5: The sizarship title added a touch of honor to his name.

meanings.definition: The duties or responsibilities associated with being a sizar.
meanings.sent1: The sizarship required him to assist in various tasks around the campus.
meanings.sent2: She diligently fulfilled her sizarship duties every day.
